description: Consider a (solid) triangle with n cells on each edge, for a total of n(n+1)/2 cells; a(n) is number of inequivalent ways of labeling cells with 0's and 1's; triangle may be rotated and turned over.
maple: A061348 := proc(n) local t1, v, a; a := n*(n+1)/2; v := floor((n+1)/2); if n mod 3 = 1 then t1 := n*(n+1)/6+2/3; else t1 := n*(n+1)/6; fi; (1/6)*(2^a + 2*2^t1+3*2^(a/2+v/2)); end; # from Burnside's Lemma
author: Michel ten Voorde (seqfan(AT)tenvoorde.org), Jun 08 2001
extensions: Formula and more terms from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 20 2001
